did.abstract: Papers of a soldier with the 339th Infantry in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Maxson E. Andrews, of West Branch, Michigan, in 2007 (Donor No. 9885).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., Ernest Oliver Andrews papers, 1918-1950s, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Andrews, a resident of West Branch, Michigan, was a private with the 339th Infantry, Company C, sent to northern Russia at the end of World War I.

scopecontent.p: This collection is divided into three series, Papers, Visual Materials, and Memorabilia.

The Visual Materials series includes a portrait of Andrews in uniform and at veterans activities. Of the ten photographs in this series, the only dated photograph is the portrait of Andrews in uniform which is dated 1919-1920.
